metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: To build a vertical navigation bar, you can style the <a> elements inside the list, in addition to the code from the previous page:
content.html: To build a vertical navigation bar, you can style the <a> elements inside the list, in addition to the code from the previous page:

content.code_html:
li a {
  display: block;
  width: 60px;
}

content.text: You can also set the width of <ul>, and remove the width of <a>, as they will take up the full width available when displayed as block elements. This will produce the same result as our previous example:
content.html: You can also set the width of <ul>, and remove the width of <a>, as they will take up the full width available when displayed as block elements. This will produce the same result as our previous example:

content.code_html:
ul {
  list-style-type: none;
  margin: 0;
  padding: 0;
  width: 60px;
}

li a {
  display: block;
}

content.text: Create a basic vertical navigation bar with a gray background color and change the background color of the links when the user moves the mouse over them:
content.html: Create a basic vertical navigation bar with a gray background color and change the background color of the links when the user moves the mouse over them:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
display: 
block;  color: #000;  padding: 8px 16px;  text-decoration: none;

/* 
Change the link color on hover */

syntax_highlighting.text:
display: 
block;  color: #000;  padding: 8px 16px;  text-decoration: none;

/* 
Change the link color on hover */

content.code_html:
ul {
  list-style-type: none;
  margin: 0;
  padding: 0;
  width: 200px;
  background-color: #f1f1f1;
}

li a {
  display: block;
  color: #000;
  padding: 8px 16px;
  text-decoration: none;
}

/* Change the link color on hover */
li a:hover {
  background-color: #555;
  color: white;
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
display: 
block;  color: #000;  padding: 8px 16px;  text-decoration: none;

/* 
Change the link color on hover */

content.text: Add an "active" class to the current link to let the user know which page he/she is on:
content.html: Add an "active" class to the current link to let the user know which page he/she is on:

content.code_html:
.active {
  background-color: #04AA6D;
  color: white;
}

content.text: Add text-align:center to <li> or <a> to center the links.
content.html: Add text-align:center to <li> or <a> to center the links.

content.text: Add the border property to <ul> to add a border around the navbar. If you also want borders inside the navbar, add a border-bottom to all <li> elements, except for the last one:
content.html: Add the border property to <ul> to add a border around the navbar. If you also want borders inside the navbar, add a border-bottom to all <li> elements, except for the last one:

content.code_html:
ul {
  border: 1px solid #555;
}

li {
  text-align: center;
  border-bottom: 1px solid #555;
}

li:last-child {
  border-bottom: none;
}

25%;  background-color: #f1f1f1;  height: 100%; /* Full height */
    position: fixed; /* 
Make it stick, even on scroll */  
overflow: auto; /* Enable scrolling if the sidenav has too much content */

content.code_html:
ul {
  list-style-type: none;
  margin: 0;
  padding: 0;
  width: 25%;
  background-color: #f1f1f1;
  height: 100%; /* Full height */
  position: fixed; /* Make it stick, even on scroll */
  overflow: auto; /* Enable scrolling if the sidenav has too much content */
}

content.text: Note: This example might not work properly on mobile devices.
content.html: Note: This example might not work properly on mobile devices.
